=API for javalog=
Usage: 
{{{
(ns <your-namespace>
  (:use clojure.contrib.javalog))
}}}


==Public Variables and Functions==
Shortcuts:
[#*logger* *logger*] [#(_add-log-file_logger-name_filename) add-log-file] [#(_log_level_&_strings) log] [#(_log-level_level) log-level] [#(_root-logger_) root-logger] [#(_set-console-log-level_level) set-console-log-level] [#(_with-logger_logger-name_level_&_body) with-logger] 

----
===_`*`logger`*`_===
<pre> The current java.util.logging.Logger.  By default, the
global logger, modified by 'with-logger'.</pre>

[http://code.google.com/p/clojure-contrib/source/browse/trunk/src/clojure/contrib/javalog.clj#39 Source]
----
===(_add-log-file_ logger-name filename)===
===(_add-log-file_ logger-name filename level)===
<pre> Attaches a log file, using SimpleFormatter, with the given level,
to the named logger.  'level' defaults to ALL.  Note: multiple
invocations will create multiple log files, with numbers appended to
the names.</pre>

[http://code.google.com/p/clojure-contrib/source/browse/trunk/src/clojure/contrib/javalog.clj#83 Source]
----
===(_log_ level & strings)===
====Macro====
<pre> Logs a message to `*`logger`*`.  'level' is expanded with 'log-level'.
Example: (log :severe "Bad argument: " object)</pre>

[http://code.google.com/p/clojure-contrib/source/browse/trunk/src/clojure/contrib/javalog.clj#105 Source]
----
===(_log-level_ level)===
====Macro====
<pre> Translates 'level' (a lower-case keyword) into a static field of
java.util.logging.Level, by name.  

 Example: (log-level :severe)  =>  java.util.logging.Level.SEVERE

 If 'level' is not a keyword, it is assumed to be a user-defined
instance of java.util.logging.Level and is returned unchanged.</pre>

[http://code.google.com/p/clojure-contrib/source/browse/trunk/src/clojure/contrib/javalog.clj#48 Source]
----
===(_root-logger_)===
===(_root-logger_ logger)===
<pre> Returns the root Logger instance.</pre>

[http://code.google.com/p/clojure-contrib/source/browse/trunk/src/clojure/contrib/javalog.clj#62 Source]
----
===(_set-console-log-level_ level)===
<pre> Attempts to set the level of the current logger and the root
ConsoleHandler to 'level' (a java.util.logging.Level).  Useful for
debugging at the REPL.</pre>

[http://code.google.com/p/clojure-contrib/source/browse/trunk/src/clojure/contrib/javalog.clj#70 Source]
----
===(_with-logger_ logger-name level & body)===
====Macro====
<pre> Executes 'body' with `*`logger`*` bound to a logger with the given name
and level.  'level' is expanded with 'log-level'.</pre>

[http://code.google.com/p/clojure-contrib/source/browse/trunk/src/clojure/contrib/javalog.clj#97 Source]
